intro: Chamaesyce sistanica, commonly known as the Sistan weed, is a flowering plant native to regions of Iran and Afghanistan. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. It has a low-growing habit and produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its hardy nature, it is considered a weed in some areas but also has potential for use in xerophytic landscaping.
